column2: ENGLISH
If you can see this, then it means I fucked up. Please contact ANON on 8/v/'s /gsg/ thread. Thanks.
The Schomburgk Line

In 1835, under the aegis of the Royal Geographical Society, the German-born explorer and naturalist Robert Hermann Schomburgk conducted botanical and geographical exploration of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Guiana. This resulted in a sketch of the territory with a line marking what he believed to be the western boundary claimed by the Dutch. As a result of this, he was commissioned in $YEAR$ by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to survey Guiana's boundaries. This survey resulted in what came to be known as the "Schomburgk Line". The Line goes well beyond the area of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ occupation, and technically gives us control of the mouth of the Orinoco River, as well as other territories not currently under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control
May the sun never set on our Empire!
The Schomburgk Line

In 1835, under the aegis of the Royal Geographical Society, the German-born explorer and naturalist Robert Hermann Schomburgk conducted botanical and geographical exploration of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Guiana. This resulted in a sketch of the territory with a line marking what he believed to be the western boundary claimed by the Dutch. As a result of this, he was commissioned in $YEAR$ by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government to survey Guiana's boundaries. This survey resulted in what came to be known as the "Schomburgk Line". The Line goes well beyond the area of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ occupation, and technically gives them control of the mouth of the Orinoco River, as well as other territories not currently under $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ control
Those bastards!
Declare the Essequibo River as the Guyanese border

Based on the territory of the then General Captaincy of Venezuela and the ‘Uti Possidetis Iure’ principle of international law, the Essequibo River has to be internationally recognized as the dividing line between Venezuela and the colony of British Guiana. After the scandalous episode of the so-called ‘Schomburgk Line’, in which the British Empire violated our national sovereignty by placing claims on rightful $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soil, our countrymen must be urged to settle the empty lands west of the Essequibo River in order to put more weight on our claims, the British Empire must also be formally asked to cease all encroachments on our territories
$FROMCOUNTRY$ declares the Essequibo River as the Guyanese border

Based on the principles of ‘Uti Possidetis Iure’ and the old territories of the General Captaincy of Venezuela, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has formally placed a complaint to cease all incursions and claims on their sovereignty which were laid by the geographical expedition of Robert Schomburgk in the previous year. Their claims are legitimate but so are ours, what shall be done about it?
Show them that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ never back down
Abandon all claims laid by the Schomburgk Line
$FROMCOUNTRY$ retracts all claims on our territories!
In an odd turn of events, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has abandoned all their claims on our territories and will promptly cede their sovereignty to us
Great!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ retracts all claims on our territories!
In an odd turn of events, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has abandoned all their claims on our territories and will promptly cede their sovereignty to us
Great!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ retracts all claims on our territories!
In an odd turn of events, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has abandoned all their claims on our territories and will promptly cede their sovereignty to us
Great!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ retracts all claims on our territories!
In an odd turn of events, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has abandoned all their claims on our territories and will promptly cede their sovereignty to us
Great!
The Agreement of $YEAR$

Since the British Empire will not back down on their claims laid by the Schomburgk Line, we must reach a compromise by agreeing not to further encroach on disputed Guyanese territory until all matters pertaining our border disputes have been solved
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Agreement of $YEAR$
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Government wishes to come to an agreement that no further encroachments on disputed Guianese territories will be partaken until our border disputes have been solved
An excellent initiative!
Reject such inane proposition
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have accepted our proposition!
Brilliant!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have rejected our proposition!
Curse them!
Extend the Schomburgk Line!

Our diplomatic and military superiority leaves us in a position in which it is possible to extend the Schomburgk Line, beyond our claimed territories, to also include the gold mines of Guasipati and El Callao. This, of course, will not be well received by the Venezuelans..
The mysterious extension of the Schomburgk Line

In $YEAR$, a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Geographical Magazine published what appeared to be an altered version of the Schomburgk Line, giving $FROMCOUNTRY$ claims over the territories of Guasipati and El Callao, which are teeming with gold… The Royal Geographical Society now considers these territories to be rightfully $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$
Curse them!
Declare the Schomburgk Line as the provisional $COUNTRY_ADJ$ frontier
In order to secure our claims in Guyana, we must declare the Schomburgk Line as the provisional frontier of our colony
$FROMCOUNTRY$ declares the Schomburgk Line as the provisional frontier of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Guiana
In a bold and unexpected move, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has declared the Schomburgk Line as the provisional frontier of their colony
Somebody stop them!
A formal request to cease all incursions on Guyanese territory

The $MONARCHTITLE$ of $COUNTRY$, widely informed by his bureau of commissioners about the invasion of Venezuelan territory by the English, must demand the immediate withdrawal of British subjects from the Orinoco and Pomaron rivers in order to maintain the status quo which was agreed upon in 1850
A formal request to cease all incursions on Guyanese territory

The President of $FROMCOUNTRY$, widely informed by his bureau of commissioners about the invasion of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ territory by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$, demands the immediate withdrawal of our subjects from the Orinoco and Pomaron rivers in order to maintain the status quo which was agreed upon in 1850
Show them that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ never back down
They are more trouble than it is worth it
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$, in all their illusory superiority, have diplomatically insulted us by breaking the agreement of 1850. This calls for immediate action against their incursions
The first step is to severe diplomatic relations
It is better not to incur on their rage
Abandon our claims, they are more trouble than it is worth it.
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ President has decided to sever all diplomatic relations with our Empire
Then we shall do the same
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ President has decided to do nothing about our bold declaration
They are baffled by our superiority!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ President has decided to abandon all claims on our rightful Guianese territories
They are baffled by our superiority!
An Incursion to El Callao

The rich gold mines of El Callao have proven to be very profitable for the Venezuelan Government, and since our great Empire has also got legitimate claims on them, it is our duty to assert dominance over the area by sending $COUNTRY_ADJ$ settlers to claim the land
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ to El Callao

The rich gold mines of El Callao have proven to be very profitable for our government, and since the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have got illegitimate claims over the area, they think they can simply take it away from us by sending settlers to establish their own mining companies on our sovereign territory
The Eternal Anglo strikes once again
The British Usurpers in Guyana

Ever since the British declaration of the Schomburgk Line as the provisional frontier of their Guyanese colony, the English have been constantly sending more and more settlers to our territories… Their latest usurpation of our sovereignty just so happened a few days ago with the establishment of several camps, led by British settlers, in the vincinity of El Callao. This calls for immediate action from our part
The British Usurpers in Guyana

Ever since the British declaration of the Schomburgk Line as the provisional frontier of their Guyanese colony, the English have been constantly sending more and more settlers to our territories… Their latest usurpation of our sovereignty just so happened a few days ago with the establishment of several camps, led by British settlers, in the vincinity of El Callao. This calls for immediate action from our part
Expel them from El Callao
Expel them all from our country
Do nothing, lest we incur on their wrath!
The trespassers must be disposed of!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ expels $COUNTRY_ADJ$ settlers from El Callao!
In a bold and unexpected move, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to expel all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ settlers from El Callao
Curse them, it is our land!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ expels $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens!
In a bold and unexpected move, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to expel all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens from their country
Preposterous!
The systematic extermination of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens in $FROMCOUNTRY$!
In a preposterous and unexpected move, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided systematically kill all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens from our claimed territories in Guiana
Those bastards!
Appeal to the USA for mediation

The latest actions of the British Empire against our territories very well threaten our sovereignty, clearly transgressing the Monroe Doctrine of the USA, which states that further efforts by European nations to take control of any independent state in North or South America would be viewed as "the manifestation of an unfriendly disposition toward the United States." We must ask for their assistance on this matter lest we have our land stolen
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Plea

The latest actions of the British Empire against $FROMCOUNTRY$ very well threaten their sovereignty, clearly transgressing our Monroe Doctrine, which states that further efforts by European nations to take control of any independent state in North or South America would be viewed as "the manifestation of an unfriendly disposition toward the United States." Clearly, they are very nervous about any further British encroachment. What shall we do about it?
Express concern, but decline any requests for involvement
Simply ignore them
We must do something about it!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ President has finally given us a response, they appear to be deeply concerned but have not expressed any further interest on mediating our issue
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ President has finally given us a response, they appear to be uninterested to mediate our issue
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ President has finally given us a response, they are deeply concerned about Britain's latest actions and have decided to mediate our issue
Hurray!
William L. Scruggs

William L. Scruggs, Lawyer and former American Ambassador to $COUNTRY$, has offered his services as a Lobbyist and Legal Attache in taking our issue with the British Empire to the American Parliament. It would be wise to accept his services..
An Ultimatum from $FROMCOUNTRY$!

It appears that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to back Venezuela on our territorial dispute, and by citing the Monroe Doctrine of 1823, they believe our actions are a clear transgression against their inane and baseless doctrine. $FROMCOUNTRY$ wishes to take our issue to an international court of law hosted by a neutral and unbiased arbiter lest they take further actions against our wrongly-percieved territorial claims. What shall we do?
Accept the proposal, but mention nothing about the Monroe Doctrine
Reject such inane proposition
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted our ultimatum
Onwards to Liberty!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has succumbed to the American ultimatum
Great!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has rejected our ultimatum
Then further actions shall be taken!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has rejected the American ultimatum
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$

The United States of America and the British Empire have selected our country, as a neutral entity, to host an arbitration regarding the territorial disputes between the Colony of British Guiana and the Venezuelan Essequibo. $COUNTRY$, as the arbiter on this issue, has been given a special authority to vote on how this territorial dispute shall be solved… As the parties involved cannot reach a proper agreement on the ownership of the Guyanese territories, it is up to us to decide how the lands are awarded between all parties. In the end, our voice shall be taken as the final arbitration

Trouble brews in South America after a longstanding territorial dispute between the United Kingdom and Venezuela finally turns into an international crisis. The territories of Essequibo and Guayana Esequiba, which Britain claims as part of British Guiana and Venezuela see as Venezuelan territory, have been taken to an international court of law located in $COUNTRY$, which shall serve as a neutral arbiter. As the dispute turned into a crisis, the key issue became Britain's refusal to include in the proposed international arbitration the territory east of the ‘Schomburgk Line’, which a surveyor had drawn half a century earlier as a boundary between Venezuela and the former Dutch territory of British Guiana

Trouble brews in South America after a longstanding territorial dispute between the United Kingdom and Venezuela finally turns into an international crisis. The territories of Essequibo and Guayana Esequiba, which Britain claims as part of British Guiana and Venezuela see as Venezuelan territory, have been taken to an international court of law located in $COUNTRY$, which shall serve as a neutral arbiter.
Trouble brews in South America after a longstanding territorial dispute between the United Kingdom and Venezuela finally turns into an international crisis
Award Britain with the territories of the Schomburgk Line, minus Barima and El Callao
Award Britain with the territories of the Schomburgk Line, minus El Callao
Award Britain with the territories of the Schomburgk Line
Deny Britain of its claims, they rightfully belong to Venezuela
The original borders before the Schomburgk survey shall stand
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$
The international arbiters have reached a conclusion: The territories claimed by the Schomburgk Line shall be awarded to the British, minus Barima and El Callao
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$
The international arbiters have reached a conclusion: The territories claimed by the Schomburgk Line shall be awarded to the British, minus El Callao
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$
The international arbiters have reached a conclusion: The territories claimed by the Schomburgk Line shall be awarded to the British
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$
The international arbiters have reached a conclusion: The Schomburgk Line has been deemed null and illegal and all territories claimed by Britain have been awarded to $COUNTRY$
Hurray!
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$

The international arbiters have reached a conclusion: The Schomburgk Line has been deemed null and illegal and all territories claimed by Britain have been awarded to Venezuela. Our claims on Tigri have been awarded to us
Hurray!
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$
The international arbiters have reached a conclusion: The Schomburgk Line has been deemed null and illegal and all territories claimed by Britain have been awarded to Venezuela
The Venezuelan Crisis of $YEAR$
The international arbiters have reached a conclusion: The Schomburgk Line has been deemed null and illegal and the original borders before the Schomburgk Survey shall stand
The Pirara Question
$COUNTRY$ must propose an arbitration to delimit its borders in the territory of the Pirara which have been claimed by the British Empire
The Pirara Question
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has proposed an arbitration to delimit its borders in the territory of the Pirara which have been claimed by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Colony of Guiana
Ignore them
Subject the matter to an international arbitration
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have decided to ignore our request
Those bastards!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have decided to subject the matter to an international arbitration
Great!
The Pirara Question

Brazil has proposed an arbitration to delimit its borders in the territory of the Pirara which have been claimed by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Colony of Guiana. $COUNTRY$ has been selected as a neutral arbiter on this matter and as such, it is our vote which will delimit the borders between the two countries
Award $FROMCOUNTRY$ with Mau
Award $FROMCOUNTRY$ with all of their claims
Reject $FROMCOUNTRY$'s claims and award them to the other party instead
The Pirara Question, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has awarded the British with the territories of Mau
The Pirara Question, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has awarded the British with all their claimed territories
The Pirara Question, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has rejected the British claims over Mau and Pirara, which will soonly be awarded to its rightful owner
A Tripartite Alliance against British claims on Guyana

In 1840, the British Empire laid claims over a vast territory spanning over several countries in the Guyanas, this is known as the ‘Schomburgk Line’, which also affects our sovereignty. In order to overcome this transgression on our rightful soil, an alliance between the affected parties must be formed against the British claims, lest we find ourselves robbed of our territories by the foul-playing English
A Tripartite Alliance against British claims on Guyana

An Ambassador from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has recently approached the $MONARCHTITLE$ of $COUNTRY$, he wishes to form an alliance of countries affected by the ‘Schomburgk Line’, the British geographical survey in the Guyanas which laid claims on our territories, against any further English encroachments
By all means, lets accept their proposition!
Reject their proposition
A Tripartite Alliance against British claims on Guyana, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ response
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ accepts our proposition and wishes to form an alliance against further British incursions
Brilliant!
A Tripartite Alliance against British claims on Guyana, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ response
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rejects our proposition to form an alliance against further British incursions
Curse them!
A formal request to the United States of America

As the leader of the Tripartite Alliance against British claims on Guyana, it is our duty to present a formal request to the USA for mediation on all matters pertaining to the British Empire and the Schomburgk Line. With aid from the Americans and their Monroe Doctrine, which states that further efforts by European nations to take control of any independent state in North or South America would be viewed as "the manifestation of an unfriendly disposition toward the United States", we could surely pressure the British to recognize our claims and subject our dispute to an international court of law for its subsequent arbitration
A formal request from $FROMCOUNTRY$

$FROMCOUNTRY$, the Leader of the so-called "Tripartite Alliance" against British claims on Guyana, has presented a formal request to $COUNTRY$ for mediation on all matters pertaining to the British Empire and the Schomburgk Line. The Tripartite Alliance considers $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aid to be paramout, due to our position in both regional and international politics, as well as for our Monroe Doctrine, which states that further efforts by European nations to take control of any independent state in North or South America would be viewed as "the manifestation of an unfriendly disposition toward the United States", $FROMCOUNTRY$ wishes to employ our help in order to press the British to recognize the Alliance's claims and subject their territorial dispute to an international court of law for its subsequent arbitration. What shall be done now, Mr. $MONARCHTITLE$?
By all means, let us stand against British aggression!
We have more important things to do..
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to back our alliance against Britain!
Great!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to back our alliance against Britain!
Curse them!
An ultimatum for the British Empire

With the combined diplomatic efforts of our Tripartite Alliance and the United States of America, we can put enough pressure on the British Empire to recognize the legitimacy of our claims over the dubious validity of their Schomburgk Line. The next step shall be issuing an ultimatum: Subject our claims to international arbitration or there shall be war
An ultimatum for the British Empire

The combined diplomatic efforts of the so-called "Tripartite Alliance" and the United States of America, are striving to place enough pressure on our Empire to recognize the legitimacy of their claims over the validity of the Schomburgk Line which was established by a geographical survey in 1840. Said alliance has issued an ultimatum: Subject our claims to international arbitration or there shall be war. What shall be done about it, Your Majesty?
We must accept their request
Then war shall it be!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted our ultimatum and shall subject their Guyanese claims to an international court of law for proper arbitration
Great!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted our ultimatum and shall subject their Guyanese claims to an international court of law for proper arbitration
Great!
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has rejected our ultimatum, we must prepare to remove their claims by force!
Si vis pacem, para bellum…
A response from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has rejected our ultimatum, we must prepare to remove their claims by force!
Si vis pacem, para bellum…
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!

In $YEAR$, an envoy from $FROMCOUNTRY$ approached our $MONARCHTITLE$, he seeks to host an arbitration in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soil, as a neutrally-perceived thirt party, in order to reach a conclusion on a longstanding issue caused by a British geographical survey in 1840: All the parties involved wish to have the validity of their claims revised by team of arbiters from different nationalities, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ included, to put an end to the Guyanese territorial dispute

Trouble brews in South America after a longstanding territorial dispute between the United Kingdom and the so-called "Tripartite Alliance", consisting in Venezuela, Brazil and the Netherlands, finally turns into an international crisis. The territories of Essequibo, Tigri, Pirara and the Guayana Esequiba, which Britain claims as part of British Guiana and members of the Tripartite Alliance see as part of their own sovereignty, have been taken to an international court of law located in $COUNTRY$, which shall serve as a neutral arbiter. As the dispute turned into a crisis, the key issue became Britain's refusal to include in the proposed international arbitration the territories of the ‘Schomburgk Line’, which a surveyor had drawn half a century earlier as a boundary between Venezuela, Brazil and the former Dutch territory of British Guiana

Trouble brews in South America after a longstanding territorial dispute between the United Kingdom and the so-called "Tripartite Alliance", consisting in Venezuela, Brazil and the Netherlands, finally turns into an international crisis. The territories of Essequibo, Tigri, Pirara and the Guayana Esequiba, which Britain claims as part of British Guiana and members of the Tripartite Alliance see as part of their own sovereignty, have been taken to an international court of law located in $COUNTRY$, which shall serve as a neutral arbiter

Trouble brews in South America after a longstanding territorial dispute between the United Kingdom and the so-called "Tripartite Alliance", consisting in Venezuela, Brazil and the Netherlands, finally turns into an international crisis
Award Britain with the territories claimed by the Schomburgk Line, minus Mau
Award Britain with all the territories claimed by the Schomburgk Line
Reject the British claims and favor the Venezuelan claims
Reject the British claims and favor the Brazilian claims
Reject the British claims and evenly distribute the remaining territories
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: Britain shall be awarded with the territories claimed by the Schomburgk Line, minus Mau
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: Britain shall be awarded with all the territories claimed by the Schomburgk Line
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected, and $COUNTRY$ has been favoured on their claims!
Hurray!
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected, and Venezuela has been favoured on their claims!
Curses!
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected and all territorial disputes have been settled!
Hurray!
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected and all territorial disputes have been settled!
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected, and Brazil has been favoured on their claims!
Curses!
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected, and $COUNTRY$ has been favoured on their claims!
Hurray!
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected, and the remaining territories have been evenly distributed!
Hurray!
The Tripartite Alliance and the USA versus the British Empire!
The international arbiters at $FROMCOUNTRY$ have reached a conclusion: The British claims have been all rejected, and the remaining territories have been evenly distributed!
Hurray!
A Thorn on Britain's Side

British incursions on what we consider to be our sovereignty has caused quite a lot of concern among $COUNTRY_ADJ$ politicians, especially so in those who consider themselves to be the paramount of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriotism, leading to heated debates on how should this matter be solved. While many propose requesting the help of European arbiters, or even the United States and its enactment of the Monroe Doctrine, many of these patriots, most of whom are veterans or the sons of veterans from the independence wars, are suggesting a much more aggressive approach: A counter-colonization program on the Guayanese territories claimed by Britain. By sending $COUNTRY_ADJ$ settlers to the territories west of the Esequibo River, $COUNTRY$’s hold, as well as claims in the area, might grow stronger and could possibly be used for leverage in future negotiations, as well as to stir up nationalistic sentiments among those $COUNTRY_ADJ$s living on British territories
A Thorn on $COUNTRY_ADJ$'s Side

Percieved $COUNTRY_ADJ$ incursions on what $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s consider to be their sovereignty has caused quite a lot of concern among $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ politicians, especially so in those who consider themselves to be the paramount of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ patriotism. While many propose requesting the help of European arbiters, or even the United States and its enactment of the Monroe Doctrine, many of these patriots, most of whom are veterans or the sons of veterans from the independence wars, are suggesting a much more aggressive approach: A counter-colonization program on the Guianese territories claimed by $COUNTRY$. By sending $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ settlers to the territories west of the Esequibo River, they believe $FROMCOUNTRY$’s hold, as well as claims in the area, might grow stronger and could possibly be used for leverage in future negotiations, as well as to stir up nationalistic sentiments among those $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s living on $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territories
Resistance is futile!
The Venezuelan Issue

Now that Venezuela has decided to enter the game of colonial domination, by contesting the territories which rightfully belong to our colony in Guiana, a heated debate has ensued on how should $COUNTRY$ tackle this issue. Our politicians cannot reach consensus, so ultimately, the responsibility befalls on the $MONARCHTITLE$ to decide which course of action should be taken…
The Venezuelan Issue

Now that Venezuela has decided to enter the game of colonial domination, by contesting the territories which rightfully belong to our colony in Guiana, a heated debate has ensued on how should $COUNTRY$ tackle this issue. Our politicians cannot reach consensus, so ultimately, the responsibility befalls on the $MONARCHTITLE$ to decide which course of action should be taken…
We must wait for their next move
Respond by sending $COUNTRY_ADJ$ settlers to our claimed territories
Deport the Venezuelans living in our Guianese colony
Simply dispose of these inferior creatures
The Venezuelan Issue, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$
After our colonization attempts on the territories west of the Esequibo river, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have not responded so far and are most likely waiting for our next move
The Venezuelan Issue, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$
After our colonization attempts on the territories west of the Esequibo river, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have decided to response by sending a large number of settlers to our territories
The Venezuelan Issue, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$

After our colonization attempts on the territories west of the Esequibo river, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have decided to deport all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens currently living in the colony $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Guiana
The Venezuelan Issue, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$

After our colonization attempts on the territories west of the Esequibo river, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have decided to systematically murder all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens currently living in the colony $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Guiana, with the pretext of a failed invasion
Those bastards!
The Venezuelan Issue, a response from $FROMCOUNTRY$

After the Venezuelan colonization attempts on the territories west of the Esequibo river, which are dubiously claimed by $FROMCOUNTRY$, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have decided to systematically murder all Venezuelan citizens currently living in the colony $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Guiana, with the pretext of a failed invasion. This is a clear transgression to our Monroe Doctrine, which we are now free to enact on $FROMCOUNTRY$..
We will not stand for this!
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Concordat

Given our rising position as a local power, an ambassador from the United States has approached our $MONARCHTITLE$ with quite a peculiar proposition: They wish to forge an informal pact in which they will provide us with military aid and counseling shall we ever engage the British Empire in a war contesting our claims in the current colony of British Guiana. It appears they wish to decrease Britain’s influence over the continent, and our claims in Guiana are a more than suitable starting point. However, despite any support we might obtain in the future, it is their wish to this whole proposition in secrecy, as they currently hold more than agreeable relations with the British Empire… Still, the Americans are ensuring us indirect support for the reclamation of our sovereign territories, something which simply cannot be dismissed
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Concordat, requesting military aid

We are currently waging a war against the British Empire and the Americans are showing their full support on our claims. It is time to request the military aid they have promised, which shall be paid upon the completion of our war
Military aid from the United States of America!
Several American ships have just docked on our ports, bringing much needed supplies for the ongoing war against the British
Excellent!
The Treaty of El Callao
The territories west of the Essequibo River are under our control. Now is the time to sit down with the British and work out a peace deal that will see them transferred back into $COUNTRY_ADJ$ hands
The Western Essequibo is Lost!

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s have proven far more resilient than we ever would have thought possible, and now we face the humiliating prospect of surrendering the territories west of the Essequibo River to them. It seems we have little choice, with the war going so badly and Georgetown already occupied. All we can do is decide whether we will pursue a conciliatory path with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s and perhaps make them future allies or aim at returning in the future and reclaiming what has been lost..

It seems they have little choice, with the war going so poorly and Georgetown already occupied. Preparations are underway for a meeting with the Venezuelans at El Callao to determine the terms of British surrender

The West Essequibo Purchase

We are interested in purchasing the territories west of the Essequibo River from Great Britain and integrating it into Venezuela. As such, we have sent delegates overseas to London and are currently awaiting a reply. Having very good relations with the UK, an alliance with them or being a Great Power will greatly improve our chances of getting a deal

The Republic of Counani

In the late nineteenth century, Jules Gros, a Journalist and member of the Société de Géographie, founded the Free Republic of Counani in a territory disputed by France (As French Guyana) and Brazil. He seeks to sell bonds for inexistent gold mines and make a fortune while also appointing himself as president for life of the newly-founded ghost republic. In France, he seeks recognition of this state as a free colony in order to gain their protection…

Founding El Callao

The gold rush in Guasipati has attracted many $COUNTRY_ADJ$ and foreign settlers to the province, which has nearly managed to collapse the old, run-down colonial town. We must employ this opportunity to settle the empty lands around the Imataca by founding a new mining town with an easier access to the gold fields. Foreign surveyors suggest the area near El Callao, one of the most productive gold deposits in the province, would be a good starting point for a new town
Build the Lawa Railway

The recent gold rush deep in the jungles of the Colony of Suriname has left us in dire need of a safe and more efficient way of transporting the precious metals to the harbor in Paramaribo. Several different surveyors have all proposed a railway extending from the coast down south to the town of Apetina, from which the gold could be transported by locomotive, it would be wise to heed their advice
Extend the Lawa Railway

Given the success of the Lawa Railway, more and more tons of gold have been brought out from the mines in Tapahony. This translates to the need of more tracks, as well as an extension of the Lawa Railway closer to the mines of the Tapahoni. Our surveyors have already proposed a route and all that's left is to invest in the project
The second extension of the Lawa Railway

The formerly disputed territory of the Marouini is also rich in gold, but its hilly jungles have proven difficult for land transportation, leaving us to transport the precious minerals via fluvial routes. Our surveyors have suggested extending the Lawa Railway once again, but this time ir shall be done to reach the abundant gold fields located in the Upper Marouini basin
Vassalize the Free State of Counani

Ambitions of other Great Powers in the area of Counani are increasing, and it's time to tight our influence on them. Under a new treaty, the Counanois agreed not to enter into relationships with any foreign government other than $COUNTRY$ without its consent. In return, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ promised to protect the Counani from all aggression by Brazil and to help in case of any invasions
Integrate the Free State of Counani
Counani, claimed by Brazil as part of their nation, is now in a position that facilitates their annexation to $COUNTRY$
The Javanese in Surinam

The Dutch, our former colonial overlord, displaced a great quantity of Javanese people to be used as indentured laborers in the colony of Surinam in South America. It is our duty, as $COUNTRY$ to bring these people back to our domain… or rather, extend our domain to them. Our position in global politics has given us the opportunity to shake off colonial rule, as well as to claim these indentured workers, which have been settled in the Americas, as a rightful part of our realm. It is time to extend our rule over these people
The Indentured Indians

The British, our former colonial overlords, displaced a great quantity of Indian peoples to be used as indentured laborers in their colonies all across the world, and adding insult to injury, they also sold many of them as indentured laborers other powers including France and the Netherlands. It is our duty, as $COUNTRY$, to bring these people back to our domain… or rather, extend our domain to them. Our position in global politics has given us the opportunity to shake off colonial rule, as well as to claim these indentured workers, as a rightful and integral part of our realm. It is time to extend our rule over these people
A formal delimitation for the Lawa-Tapahoni basins

The borders between French and Dutch Guiana have been subjected to proper delimitation on several occasions, the latest one being in 1860, but the discovery of gold in the area between the Lawa and the Tapanahoni Rivers created a new border conflict. Acting as a natural border between the two colonies, the Maroni River was selected as the frontier, but yet another question surfaced when both parties could not agree which river was the continuation and headwater of the Maroni: The Lawa to the east or the Tapahoni to the West. It is time to reach an agreement and subject this conflict to arbitration
A formal delimitation for the Lawa-Tapahoni basins

The borders between French and Dutch Guiana have been subjected to proper delimitation on several occasions, the latest one being in 1860, but the discovery of gold in the area between the Lawa and the Tapanahoni Rivers created a new border conflict. Acting as a natural border between the two colonies, the Maroni River was selected as the frontier, but yet another question surfaced when both parties could not agree which river was the continuation and headwater of the Maroni: The Lawa to the east or the Tapahoni to the West. $FROMCOUNTRY$ wishes to reach an agreement and subject this conflict to arbitration. Very well

The Marouini Question

The past arbitration of the Franco-Dutch border in Guyana, which considered the Lawa River to be the border between the two colonies, created another issue as to which river is the source of the Lawa. The Lawa River possesses two tributaries as its headwater: The Marouini to the east and the Litani to the West, of which both could be technically considered the source of the Lawa… The contested territory is the province of Marouini, containing abundant precious minerals. Suffice to say this issue must be subjected to arbitration for the wellbeing of our colony

Expel the indentured Indian workers from Guyana

In the decades prior to our conquest, the British Empire brought a sizeable quantity of indentured foreign workers to the Guyanese territories west of the Esequibo, most of these people are of ethnic Indian origin, of which a portion still practice Islam and Hinduism… And while we might welcome them to our society, they are clearly incompatible with the ideals under which $COUNTRY$ was founded. Several of our most conservative statesmen have suggested expelling them to the territories east of the Esequibo River, which are currently being held by the British. Georgetown does possess a sizeable Indian population who will surely welcome their brethren with open arms, and our guess is that the British will not complain about getting some their former subjects back
Expel the indentured Indian workers from Trinidad and Tobago

In the decades prior to our conquest, the British Empire brought a sizeable quantity of indentured foreign workers to the islands of Trinidad and Tobago, most of these people are of ethnic Indian origin, of which a portion still practice Islam and Hinduism… And while we might welcome them to our society, they are clearly incompatible with the ideals under which $COUNTRY$ was founded. Several of our most conservative statesmen have suggested shipping them to the territories east of the Esequibo River, which are currently being held by the British. Georgetown does possess a sizeable Indian population who will surely welcome their brethren with open arms, and our guess is that the British will not complain about getting some their former subjects back
Indians expelled from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
It appears that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to expel all Indians from their territories. The expelled Indians should now be arriving to Georgetown, in our colony of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Guiana
Remove British claims from Guyana

Great Britain lies defeated after the war which contested the territories claimed by the colony of British Guiana, which are now under our control. They have given us no choice but to take them by force, and as the victors, it is our duty to coerce them to sign a treaty which forfeited their claims on what rightfully belongs to the Tripartite Alliance
